name: Knox returns from Geneva
description: John Knox returned from ministering in Geneva to lead the Reformation in Scotland, carrying Genevan Reformed theology and practice into the emerging Church of Scotland.

name: Geneva exile congregation model
description: The English Congregation in Geneva (led mainly by John Knox) modeled Presbyterian worship and governance, providing a Genevan pattern that influenced later Scottish polity.

name: First Scottish presbyteries
description: Original presbyteries in the Church of Scotland were created in April 1581, marking the concrete emergence of Presbyterian polity in Scotland.

name: Scottish/Ulster migration
description: Colonial Presbyterianism originated in part through immigrants from the Church of Scotland and Presbyterians from Ireland to the American colonies.

name: First American presbytery
description: In 1706 seven ministers organized the Presbytery of Philadelphia and chose Francis Makemie as moderator, formalizing Presbyterian polity in the colonies.

name: National PCUSA formed
description: The Presbyterian Church in the United States of America was organized in 1789 as the first national Presbyterian denomination, building on colonial presbyteries and synods.

name: Branching from Scottish roots
description: The Presbyterian Church in the United States of America traces its roots to the Church of Scotland and the Synod of Ulster.

name: Colonial presbytery formation
description: Colonial Presbyterian presbyteries and synods formed the institutional base that led to the 1789 organization of the Presbyterian Church in the United States of America.
